result.execSummary:
The defendant Alton L P Green was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: 2nd/Sub. Drug Off.-Class E/F/G/H/I Fel.], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
*Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant.
*Defendant to provide a specimen for DNA testing.
*Court advised the defendant he cannot possess firearms, must provide a DNA specimen for testing and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

*No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
*Do not use or possess any illegally controlled substances.

timeConds.notes: *The first 14 days is straight time - the balance can be served with work release for the Day Report Program - no objection to electronic monitoring while in the program - no good time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alton L P Green

records.addlTxt: Received & Filed, Original SENTENCING Transcript (32 pages) commencing NOVEMBER 4, 2015 by KATHY NELSON.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order Denying Motion to Modify Sentence received and filed.  Copies mailed to attorneys./ds
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Daniel L. Konkol, Br. 44, for review. mag
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Sentence
Notice returned undeliverable
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Bail Refund Check Packet
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($50.00) gj

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) do not use or possess any illegally controlled substances; 3) random screening; 4) AODA, treatment or programs; 5) pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 6) seek and maintain employment; 7) As to Count 2:  SERVE 6 MONTHS at the House of Correction - the first 14 days is straight time - the balance can be served with work release for the Day Report Program - no objection to electronic monitoring while in the program - no good time.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) AODA, treatment or programs as recommended; 3) do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; 4) random screening;
 5) seek and maintain employment. 

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a specimen for DNA testing.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Alton L P Green in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Defendant Alton L P Green in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel, Minister Selena G. and defendant.  COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, must provide a DNA specimen for testing and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Count 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 36 months with 64 days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 18 months; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 18 months.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years.

Count 2:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 36 months with 64 days credit - concurrent with Count 1; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 18 months; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 18 months.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Counts 1 & 2 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 2 as charged in the Amended Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court by 4:00 p.m. on 11-3-15.

Court orders defendant remanded into the custody of the sheriff pending sentencing.

Defendant Alton L P Green in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Defendant Alton L P Green in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Amended Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Amended Information and waives reading.  Court accepts the Amended Information.  Court AMENDS the charges to Count 1) Possession of Narcotic Drugs, Second and Subsequent Offense 961.41(3g)(am), 961.48(1)(b) a Class I felony and Count 2) Possession of Cocaine - 2nd and Subsequent Offense 961.41(3g)(c) a Class I felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State's Requested Jury Instructions and Instructions received and filed./ds
Motions in Limine by the State received and filed./ds
State's Witness List received and filed./ds
Order returning surety received and filed.  COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT REMANDED INTO THE CUSTODY OF THE SHERIFF PENDING POSTING OF NEW BOND./ds
Notice of Petition and Petition for Discharge of Surety and Return of Bail received and filed./ds

Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg in court, defendant Alton L P Green not in court, in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow for Dennis Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Attorney Tishberg has been retained and moves to substitute in as counsel.  Attorney Phillips has provided defense with discovery.  Pretrial scheduling order received and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.

15RM043003  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
09/21/2015
Court ordered defendant turned over to Justice Point.  All previously ordered conditions of bail to remain the same.

Defendant Alton L P Green in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Defendant Alton L P Green in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant has retained attorney Mark Tishberg.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney Phillips has turned over all discovery to atty Tishberg.  

Arguments heard as to bail. 
  Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Br. 44 is not in session until 9-8-15.  Return on warrant will be heard by the pair judge Br. 33, Judge Ashley.  Case set for 9-2-15 at 9:30 a.m., Br. 33.  Attorney Phillips and the district attorney notified./ds
Justice Point, discharge summary report, received and filed.  aw
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 50.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices in court.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for motion hearing.  Parties informed the court that case would resolve in a plea.  Defendant went to Justice Point this morning, and tested positive for Cocaine, and then left before it could be addressed.  Defendant is not here.  Court issues a warrant.  Court feels high cash bail should be set when the defendant returns.
Court vacates Jury trial date.  aw
Justice Point pretrial and violation reports, received and filed.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Alton L P Green in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for status to address violation that was handled by intake court on 5/12/2015.  Defendant was admonished.  Court informs the defendant that bail will be modified if his next test is not clean.  Defendant is going to Justice Point after court.  Case remains set for motion hearing and final pretrial on 7/16/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw

Defendant Alton L P Green in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices who appears via telephone.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case Worker Monica White.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time.  Court adjourns matter before the trial court.  
  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alton L P Green in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is in trial.  Defense counsel has filed a motion.  State to respond by 6/15/2015.  Case adjourned for motion hearing and final pretrial on 7/16/2015 at 1:30 pm, and for jury trial on 8/10/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  All final pretrial documents due next court date.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.   Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.   aw  Motion hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of motion and motion to suppress, received and filed.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Alton L P Green in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State will check to see if there are any other discovery.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 4/16/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM010701  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02/25/2015

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Deputy Court Clerk:  HP  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.

Defendant Alton L P Green in court with attorney .  Defendant Alton L P Green in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Stark.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Fiorenza, Br. 3.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
